Sentencas: The gadolinium-doped ceria ( CGO ) is of great interest as oxide ion conducing solid electrolyte for intermediate and low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) operation.
Titulo: Sol-Gel Production of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 Nanopowders Using Sucrose and Pectin as Organic Precursors

Sentencas: In this investigation, high-purity nanopowders of cerium gadolinium oxide ( CGO , Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9) are synthesized by sol-gel method using sucrose as an organic chelating agent and pectin for gelation.
Titulo: Sol-Gel Production of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 Nanopowders Using Sucrose and Pectin as Organic Precursors

Sentencas: The results of this investigation indicate that the final particle size of approximately 8 nm can be obtained after calcination of the predried gel at 500 degrees C for 2 h in ambient air.
Titulo: Sol-Gel Production of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 Nanopowders Using Sucrose and Pectin as Organic Precursors

Sentencas: An insight in to the calcination process has been obtained by using simultaneous thermogravimetric analysis and differential scanning calorimetry (TGA/DSC).
Titulo: Sol-Gel Production of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 Nanopowders Using Sucrose and Pectin as Organic Precursors

Sentencas: Powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) confirms that all samples crystallized as single phase cubic CGO powders with no trace of impurity.
Titulo: Sol-Gel Production of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 Nanopowders Using Sucrose and Pectin as Organic Precursors

Sentencas: The mean crystallite sizes calculated from XRD analysis using Rietveld refinement method agree with the morphological features observed using transmission electron microscopy (TEM).
Titulo: Sol-Gel Production of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 Nanopowders Using Sucrose and Pectin as Organic Precursors

Sentencas: The nanopowders produced in this study exhibit negligible strain as indicated by Rietveld refinement procedure.
Titulo: Sol-Gel Production of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 Nanopowders Using Sucrose and Pectin as Organic Precursors

Sentencas: The nominal composition of CGO has been found to be in excellent agreement with that determined independently using energy dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDS) and inductively coupled plasmaatomic emission spectrometry analysis (ICPAES).
Titulo: Sol-Gel Production of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 Nanopowders Using Sucrose and Pectin as Organic Precursors

Sentencas: The XRD and TEM analyses indicate that there is a significant influence of calcination temperature on the crystal size, which increases with increasing temperature for a fixed annealing time.
Titulo: Sol-Gel Production of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 Nanopowders Using Sucrose and Pectin as Organic Precursors
